html: Hate incidents target victims based on their actual or perceived race, religion, sex, and sexual orientation. Some of these incidents may be crimes, and some are not, but all of them harm not only individuals but also our communities and, ultimately, our entire nation.
text: Hate incidents target victims based on their actual or perceived race, religion, sex, and sexual orientation. Some of these incidents may be crimes, and some are not, but all of them harm not only individuals but also our communities and, ultimately, our entire nation.

html: Hate incidents are increasing in the United States, and these statistics have been on the rise in recent years, with hate crimes surging 20 percent last year, and a plurality of these crimes—29 percent—being motivated by anti-black bias.

html: In light of the very concerning discrepancies and final decision making at the Justice Department following the Special Counsel report, where Mueller did not exonerate the President, we will be calling Attorney General Barr in to testify before @HouseJudiciary in the near future.
text: In light of the very concerning discrepancies and final decision making at the Justice Department following the Special Counsel report, where Mueller did not exonerate the President, we will be calling Attorney General Barr in to testify before @HouseJudiciary in the near future.

html: Special Counsel Mueller worked for 22 months to determine the extent to which President Trump obstructed justice. Attorney General Barr took 2 days to tell the American people that while the President is not exonerated, there will be no action by DOJ.
text: Special Counsel Mueller worked for 22 months to determine the extent to which President Trump obstructed justice. Attorney General Barr took 2 days to tell the American people that while the President is not exonerated, there will be no action by DOJ.

html: There must be full transparency in what Special Counsel Mueller uncovered to not exonerate the President from wrongdoing. DOJ owes the public more than just a brief synopsis and decision not to go any further in their work.
text: There must be full transparency in what Special Counsel Mueller uncovered to not exonerate the President from wrongdoing. DOJ owes the public more than just a brief synopsis and decision not to go any further in their work.

html: But Special Counsel Mueller clearly and explicitly is not exonerating the President, and we must hear from AG Barr about his decision making and see all the underlying evidence for the American people to know all the facts.
text: But Special Counsel Mueller clearly and explicitly is not exonerating the President, and we must hear from AG Barr about his decision making and see all the underlying evidence for the American people to know all the facts.

html: Barr says that the President may have acted to obstruct justice, but that for an obstruction conviction, “the government would need to proved beyond a reasonable doubt that a person, acting with corrupt intent, engaged in obstructive conduct”.
text: Barr says that the President may have acted to obstruct justice, but that for an obstruction conviction, “the government would need to proved beyond a reasonable doubt that a person, acting with corrupt intent, engaged in obstructive conduct”.

html: This bill once and for all explicitly bans discrimination against the LGBTQ community and would ensure its full integration into all areas of American life, including in employment, housing, credit, education, public accommodations, federally funded programs, and jury service.

html: It was a powerful moment as I voted for the first major gun safety bill in decades & saw the House gallery filled w/ advocates who have fought for this moment for years. After Sandy Hook, Pulse, Las Vegas, daily gun violence, and especially after Parkland, finally we acted. #HR8

It was a powerful moment as I voted for the first major gun safety bill in decades & saw the House gallery filled w/ advocates who have fought for this moment for years.

html: Nadler on Whitaker: "We have given you months to prepare. We publicly documented every request we have made to you. We provided our Republican colleagues with an opportunity to weigh in on the process. We have nothing to hide from you. We hope you have nothing to hide from us.”
text: Nadler on Whitaker: "We have given you months to prepare.  We publicly documented every request we have made to you.  We provided our Republican colleagues with an opportunity to weigh in on the process. We have nothing to hide from you. We hope you have nothing to hide from us.”

html: Nadler on Whitaker: "And although I am willing to work with the Department to obtain this information, I will not allow that process to drag out for weeks and months. The time for this Administration to postpone accountability is over.”
text: Nadler on Whitaker: "And although I am willing to work with the Department to obtain this information, I will not allow that process to drag out for weeks and months.  The time for this Administration to postpone accountability is over.”

html: Lights are back on at the #MDCBrooklyn #MDC!!!! Excellent news. I promise to look into why this happened and ensure that the BOP makes the necessary improvements so there is not a repeat of these horrendous conditions. We must treat inmates with dignity and respect.

html: The New York State Senate banned conversion therapy today. I am overwhelmed. Conversion therapy has always been a form of child abuse, leveled against LGBTQ kids who others refuse to accept. We've always known that our children are born perfect. Now the law recognizes it, too.
text:
The New York State Senate banned conversion therapy today. I am overwhelmed.

Conversion therapy has always been a form of child abuse, leveled against LGBTQ kids who others refuse to accept. We've always known that our children are born perfect. Now the law recognizes it, too.

html: You can be sure that, beginning in January, this Committee intends to do its job, in a fair, but firm, manner. The time for zero accountability is over, and we are determined to ensure that @DHSgov’s policies and practices are aligned with the laws and values of the nation.
text: You can be sure that, beginning in January, this Committee intends to do its job, in a fair, but firm, manner. The time for zero accountability is over, and we are determined to ensure that @DHSgov’s policies and practices are aligned with the laws and values of the nation.

html: We must also conduct much-needed oversight over the disastrous family separation policy. Not only was the policy abhorrent, it is clear that DHS was either incompetent, or grossly negligent, in its implementation, which only compounded the trauma inflicted on innocent children.
text: We must also conduct much-needed oversight over the disastrous family separation policy. Not only was the policy abhorrent, it is clear that DHS was either incompetent, or grossly negligent, in its implementation, which only compounded the trauma inflicted on innocent children.

html: The Administration’s dangerous and chaotic policies have caused desperate people to use desperate means to find protection for themselves and for their children.
text: The Administration’s dangerous and chaotic policies have caused desperate people to use desperate means to find protection for themselves and for their children.

html: The fact that U.S. Customs & Border Protection does not conduct a full medical examination of people it holds in its custody is outrageous and is a policy that should be changed today.
text: The fact that U.S. Customs & Border Protection does not conduct a full medical examination of people it holds in its custody is outrageous and is a policy that should be changed today.

html: As we move into the next Congress, I want to put you and your department on notice: the time for accountability has arrived.

html: On a day like today, 54 years ago, President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the historic Civil Rights Act of 1964. The law enshrined antidiscrimination protections in public accommodations, the workplace, and educational programs, among other provisions.pic.twitter.com/TE62CkeRWf
text:
On a day like today, 54 years ago, President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the historic Civil Rights Act of 1964.

The law enshrined antidiscrimination protections in public accommodations, the workplace, and educational programs, among other provisions.pic.twitter.com/TE62CkeRWf
